result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion to forfeit bail granted.

12:44 PM Defendant Geronimo Placencia-Cabral not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.  Warrant remains.
Bail/bond hearing on January 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.

CASH BOND IS TO BE CONVERTED TO A SIGNATURE BOND ONLY WHTN THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY AUTHORITIES PICK HIM UP FOR TRANSPORT IN HIS MILWAUKEE COUNTY CASE.  IF THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY AUTHORITIES DO NOT ACCEPT HIM OR HE IS TO BE RELEASED ON THAT MATTER, THE BOND IS TO IMMEDIATELY REVERT BACK TO THE ORIGINAL CASH BOND AND CONDITIONS SET ON 11/17/14.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.    Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody. Defendant Geronimo Placencia-Cabral in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bailey received discovery late last week and a pretrial offer today.  There is a pending Milwaukee County case in warrant status.  Defense requests modification to a signature bond to allow the defendant to pursue the more serious case first.  Defense withdraws speedy trial demand.  Court grants motion of the defense and orders the bond modified.  Cash bond is to be converted to a signature bond in the amount of $10,000.00 only when the Milwaukee County authorities pick the defendant up for transport.  If the Milwaukee County authorities do not accept him or release him the bond is to immediately revert back to the original cash bond and conditions set on 11/17/14.  Hearing set for 2/2/14 to remain on the court's calendar as previously set.
Hearing on December 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
